sentences.english: Summer afternoons are frequently accompanied by thunderstorms.
sentences.chinese: 夏天的午後經常伴有雷暴雨。

sentences.english: Chicago endured blizzard conditions and thundersnow, along with half a meter of snow accumulation.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥處於暴風雪和雷暴天氣，會有半米左右的積雪。

sentences.english: Energy can be released and intense convective activity and maybe thunder storms are likely to develop.
sentences.chinese: 能量能夠釋放，強對流活動和雷暴就可能發展。

sentences.english: Never shelter under a tree during thunder- storms.
sentences.chinese: 雷暴雨時，千萬不能到樹下去躲雨。

sentences.english: Fortunately the thunderstorm kept off until we were safely indoors.
sentences.chinese: 幸好我們已經安全地回到家裏雷暴雨纔來到。

sentences.english: During the passage of a thunderstorm pressure has pronounced change.
sentences.chinese: 在雷暴過境時，氣壓有着明顯變化。

sentences.english: Heavy thundery rain fell throughout Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 星期四下了一整天的雷暴雨。

sentences.english: One afternoon while we were there at that lake a thunderstorm came up.
sentences.chinese: 有天下午我們在湖畔時，來了一陣雷暴。

sentences.english: Rain will be heavy at times with a few squally thunderstorms.
sentences.chinese: 雨將沉重的時候，與數狂風雷暴。

sentences.english: The loudest part of the storm moved away from us across the desert.
sentences.chinese: 雷暴雨的最洪亮的部分已經穿過了沙漠，離我們而去。

sentences.english: Thunderstorms have struck northern China, bringing heavy rain and causing traffic chaos.
sentences.chinese: 雷暴襲擊了中國北方，帶來了暴雨並造成交通混亂。

sentences.english: How many days of thunderstorm does New Brunswick have?
sentences.chinese: 請問新布朗司威克一年有多少天雷暴？

sentences.english: Below you can see some examples of thunderstorms and some superb supercells.
sentences.chinese: 下面你將看到一些雷暴和極炫的超雷雨胞例子。

sentences.english: Do lights blink during lightning storms?
sentences.chinese: 在雷暴期間，燈光是否會閃爍不定？

sentences.english: The thunderstorm may settle the weather.
sentences.chinese: 這場雷暴過後天氣可能反而好些。

sentences.english: The cloud is a pyrocumulonimbus cloud, a powerful thunderstorm that forms over large fires.
sentences.chinese: 這團雲霧是由下方兇猛火勢積累形成的強大的雷暴。

definition: violent rain (e.g. due to monsoon or typhoon)/cloudburst
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
